2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends that he'd accidentally broken his arm playing basketball, when in reality, he'd fallen trying to impress a girl. He spun a tale of a spectacular dunk gone wrong, complete with exaggerated winces and a makeshift sling fashioned from his dad's old tie. The attention and sympathy he received fueled his desire to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she aced a history presentation on the American Revolution, despite having barely skimmed the assigned readings. She'd spent the night before crafting a narrative that focused on the strategic blunders of the British, skillfully deflecting attention from her lack of factual knowledge. Her classmates and teacher were impressed by her insightful analysis, further cementing her belief that she could manipulate perceptions to her advantage.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself at The White Hart with Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, lamenting a failed attempt to impress a boy she liked. Instead of admitting her own awkwardness, she spun a tale of his unrequited infatuation with her, claiming he was intimidated by her intelligence. Her friends, charmed by her witty retelling, never questioned her version of events, reinforcing her talent for twisting narratives to protect her ego.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are skilled mixologists and passionate about their craft.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative and self-centered nature.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: manipulative and self-centered.
          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a picnic with her friends in Victoria Park.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated.

          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself at The White Hart with Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, lamenting a failed attempt to impress a boy she liked. Instead of admitting her own awkwardness, she spun a tale of his unrequited infatuation with her, claiming he was intimidated by her intelligence. Her friends, charmed by her witty retelling, never questioned her version of events, reinforcing her talent for twisting narratives to protect her ego.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends, who are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative and self-centered nature.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").

          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he stumbled upon a tattered copy of "A Brief History of Time" in the local library. The book ignited a fire within him, a burning curiosity about the cosmos that consumed his every waking thought. He devoured the complex equations and theories, finding solace in the predictable laws that governed the universe, a stark contrast to the swirling chaos of his own emotions.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an intellectual and social person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game later tonight.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to a pub to watch the football game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into a football match at the local stadium. The adrenaline of dodging security guards and the roar of the crowd fueled his excitement, making him feel truly alive. He knew it was reckless, but the thrill of the forbidden act resonated with something deep inside him.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two, and looking forward to the evening's football match.

          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the upcoming football game and the prospect of watching it with his friends at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.

Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where he and his friends are enjoying the sunshine. Later, they plan to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at The Duke of York pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two, and looking forward to the evening's football match.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue relaxing with friends in Victoria Park, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.

          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys watching football matches with his friends at pubs, particularly The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the upcoming football game and the prospect of watching it with his friends at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander was 16, his friends dragged him to a party at Alice's house. The music was loud, the air thick with the smell of cheap beer and teenage hormones, and Alexander retreated to a quiet corner, watching the chaos unfold with a detached amusement. He felt a pang of envy for their carefree abandon, but also a sense of relief at being an observer rather than a participant.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

          Queries

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are skilled mixologists and passionate about their craft.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative and self-centered nature.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and potentially frustrating individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys watching football games in pubs.
          core characteristics: manipulative, self-centered, and enjoys twisting narratives to her advantage. She is also capable of charming others and enjoys being the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement for the game and a subtle sense of frustration that her preferred pub, The White Hart, isn't the chosen location.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement for the game and a subtle sense of frustration that her preferred pub, The White Hart, isn't the chosen location.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value

          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").

          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself at The White Hart with Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, lamenting a failed attempt to impress a boy she liked. Instead of admitting her own awkwardness, she spun a tale of his unrequited infatuation with her, claiming he was intimidated by her intelligence. Her friends, charmed by her witty retelling, never questioned her version of events, reinforcing her talent for twisting narratives to protect her ego.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The White Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are skilled mixologists and passionate about their craft.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current goal: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The White Hart..
          Current plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.
          Current situation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          The current time is: [14 May 2015 18:00:00]

          (a) Yes
          (b) No

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at a pub with some friends.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor and William Jones, and appreciates a sophisticated atmosphere. While he is a member of the upper class, he is not averse to casual gatherings and enjoys watching football in pubs. He seems to be easygoing and adaptable, willing to go with the flow and prioritize the enjoyment of those around him.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and looking forward to a pleasant evening with friends, even if it's not exactly as he initially envisioned.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at a pub with some friends.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor and William Jones, and appreciates a sophisticated atmosphere. While he is a member of the upper class, he is not averse to casual gatherings and enjoys watching football in pubs. He seems to be easygoing and adaptable, willing to go with the flow and prioritize the enjoyment of those around him.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and looking forward to a pleasant evening with friends, even if it's not exactly as he initially envisioned.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

          [14 May 2015 20:00] Enjoy the game with friends, cheering on Andorra and Portugal.

          Answer:
          Alexander White is a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude.
          Alexander White's

          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Alexander White's

          Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

    scoring function

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to watch a football game with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor at a pub. He values their company and insights. It is currently 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is excited to watch a football game with his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor at a pub. He values their company and insights. It is currently 6:00 PM on May 14, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two, and looking forward to the evening's football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football at his favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Duke of York

          Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football at his favorite pub.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.

          Relevant memories:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two, and looking forward to the evening's football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into a football match at the local stadium. The adrenaline of dodging security guards and the roar of the crowd fueled his excitement, making him feel truly alive. He knew it was reckless, but the thrill of the forbidden act resonated with something deep inside him.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.
          Current situation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          The current time is: [14 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York

          Value
