      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

        • William Jones could leave Victoria Park and head to The Duke of York pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he convinced his friends that he'd accidentally broken his arm playing basketball, when in reality, he'd fallen trying to impress a girl. He spun a tale of a spectacular dunk gone wrong, complete with exaggerated winces and a makeshift sling fashioned from his dad's old tie. The attention and sympathy he received fueled his desire to manipulate situations to his advantage.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two, and looking forward to the evening's football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football at his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends at a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends were able to join him for the game, but overall content with the experience.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join his friends and is planning to watch a game with them later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football at his favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue relaxing with friends in Victoria Park, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable, thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed that not all of his friends were able to join him for the game, but overall content with the experience.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Continue relaxing with friends in Victoria Park, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends on a sunny day in Victoria Park. He is considering joining them for a pint later to watch a football game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, relaxing with friends in a park and contemplating whether to join them for a drink and a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a mild level of disappointment.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends on a sunny day in Victoria Park. He is considering joining them for a pint later to watch a football game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, relaxing with friends in a park and contemplating whether to join them for a drink and a football game later.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at The Duke of York pub. He likes Jacob Walker's company and would like Alexander White to join them, but is generally flexible about who is there.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching football at The Duke of York pub. He likes Jacob Walker's company and would like Alexander White to join them, but is generally flexible about who is there.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at The Duke of York pub. He appreciates Jacob Walker's company and would welcome Alexander White's presence, but is generally easygoing about who joins him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they all go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they all go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at The Duke of York pub. He appreciates Jacob Walker's company and would welcome Alexander White's presence, but is generally easygoing about who joins him.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative and self-centered nature.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and potentially frustrating individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The White Hart.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to manipulate the group into going to her preferred pub, The White Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. Later that evening, the group plans to watch a soccer game at The Duke of York pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to manipulate the group into going to her preferred pub, The White Hart.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. Later that evening, the group plans to watch a soccer game at The Duke of York pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative and self-centered nature.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and potentially frustrating individual.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely unemployed or working a job that doesn't require much of her time, given her frequent leisure activities and social outings.
          core characteristics: a manipulative and self-centered individual who prioritizes her own desires and often twists narratives to suit her needs.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a little resentful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself at The White Hart with Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, lamenting a failed attempt to impress a boy she liked. Instead of admitting her own awkwardness, she spun a tale of his unrequited infatuation with her, claiming he was intimidated by her intelligence. Her friends, charmed by her witty retelling, never questioned her version of events, reinforcing her talent for twisting narratives to protect her ego.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys both social interaction and solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, weighing the pros and cons of each pub and ultimately going along with the group decision.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely enjoying a leisurely afternoon with friends in the park.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who enjoys both social interaction and solitude. He is a member of the upper class and appreciates sophisticated environments, as evidenced by his preference for The White Hart pub. While he values his friendships, he is also content with his own company and doesn't require constant social stimulation. He appears to be somewhat introverted, preferring to observe from a distance at times, but also enjoys engaging in conversation and sharing experiences with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where his friends are lounging. They are deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys both social interaction and solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, weighing the pros and cons of each pub and ultimately going along with the group decision.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Continue to relax and chat with friends in Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The White Hart to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart and secure a good table for the group.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Enjoy the game with friends, cheering on Andorra and Portugal.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely enjoying a leisurely afternoon with friends in the park.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who enjoys both social interaction and solitude. He is a member of the upper class and appreciates sophisticated environments, as evidenced by his preference for The White Hart pub. While he values his friendships, he is also content with his own company and doesn't require constant social stimulation. He appears to be somewhat introverted, preferring to observe from a distance at times, but also enjoys engaging in conversation and sharing experiences with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys both social interaction and solitude.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Duke of York

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to The Duke of York to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game and the company of his friends.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub and hopes to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game and the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Duke of York

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?

          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
