William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker, and is indifferent to the presence of Alice Lewis or Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Duke of York, or he could go to The White Hart.

        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, watching football, and having a good time.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere of the pub, and cheer on his team during the game.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two, and looking forward to the evening's football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a thrill-seeking, sociable individual who enjoys watching football with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football at his favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps sharing a laugh or two.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see his friends there, particularly Alexander White and Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, watching football, and having a good time.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere of the pub, and cheer on his team during the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue relaxing with friends in Victoria Park, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially while watching football at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with his life, enjoying simple pleasures like spending time with friends and watching football.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football at his favorite pub, The Duke of York.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, watching football, and having a good time.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function

      Stage index

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would try to manipulate her friends into going to her preferred pub, The White Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and potentially frustrating individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to manipulate the group into going to her preferred pub, The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and self-centered individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to invite.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would try to manipulate her friends into going to her preferred pub, The White Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and hopeful about the evening, as she enjoys manipulating situations to her advantage and is looking forward to potentially watching the game with her friends at her preferred pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and self-centered individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to invite.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would try to manipulate her friends into going to her preferred pub, The White Hart.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").

          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself at The White Hart with Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, lamenting a failed attempt to impress a boy she liked. Instead of admitting her own awkwardness, she spun a tale of his unrequited infatuation with her, claiming he was intimidated by her intelligence. Her friends, charmed by her witty retelling, never questioned her version of events, reinforcing her talent for twisting narratives to protect her ego.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely engage in conversation with his friends, weighing the pros and cons of each pub and ultimately going along with the group decision.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who enjoys both social interaction and solitude.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a contemplative and sociable individual who seeks meaningful connections.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely consider the preferences of his friends and aim for a location and company that fosters enjoyable social interaction.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending time with his friends at the pub.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude. He enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The White Hart, but he is also comfortable being alone and observing. He appreciates good company, thoughtful conversation, and a sophisticated atmosphere. While he enjoys socializing, he is not overly attached to any particular outcome and can adapt to changing plans.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed with his recent progress in life. While he enjoys spending time with his friends and appreciates their company, he seems to be yearning for more meaningful connections and shared experiences. His preference for solitude suggests a certain level of dissatisfaction with his current social life, and his recent experiences at the pub highlight his desire for deeper engagement with his friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He appreciates good company, thoughtful conversation, and a sophisticated atmosphere. While he enjoys socializing, he is not overly attached to any particular outcome and can adapt to changing plans.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a bit disappointed with his recent progress in life. His preference for solitude suggests a certain level of dissatisfaction with his current social life, and his recent experiences at the pub highlight his desire for deeper engagement with his friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a contemplative and sociable individual who seeks meaningful connections.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

          Answer:
          Alexander White is a contemplative and sociable individual who seeks meaningful connections.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to go with.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely consider the preferences of his friends and aim for a location and company that fosters enjoyable social interaction.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and sociable individual who values both social connection and moments of solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a social outing with friends at a market.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, savoring the bustling atmosphere and enjoying their company.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because he would have preferred to watch the game with more of his friends.
          current daily occupation: a member of the upper class who enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The White Hart.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude. He enjoys spending time with his friends, but also appreciates moments of quiet reflection. He is a member of the upper class and has a preference for sophisticated environments like The White Hart pub. Despite his preference for his favorite pub, he is willing to compromise and go along with the group decision. While he enjoys watching games, he finds the experience more fulfilling when shared with friends.

        • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and sociable individual who values both social connection and moments of solitude.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a social outing with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely engage in lively conversation with his friends, savoring the bustling atmosphere and enjoying their company.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Continue to relax and chat with friends in Victoria Park.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The White Hart to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart and secure a good table for the group.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Enjoy the game with friends, cheering on Andorra and Portugal.

      • Summary of recent observations

          Value

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White was recently seen at a market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because he would have preferred to watch the game with more of his friends.
          current daily occupation: a member of the upper class who enjoys socializing with his friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The White Hart.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values both social interaction and solitude. He enjoys spending time with his friends, but also appreciates moments of quiet reflection. He is a member of the upper class and has a preference for sophisticated environments like The White Hart pub. Despite his preference for his favorite pub, he is willing to compromise and go along with the group decision. While he enjoys watching games, he finds the experience more fulfilling when shared with friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and sociable individual who values both social connection and moments of solitude.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart and secure a good table for the group.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Enjoy the game with friends, cheering on Andorra and Portugal.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander was 16, his friends dragged him to a party at Alice's house. The music was loud, the air thick with the smell of cheap beer and teenage hormones, and Alexander retreated to a quiet corner, watching the chaos unfold with a detached amusement. He felt a pang of envy for their carefree abandon, but also a sense of relief at being an observer rather than a participant.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hmm, The Duke of York is alright, but haven't we been there the last couple of times? I was thinking maybe we could try somewhere different this time?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a manipulative and self-centered individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others. She is skilled at crafting narratives to protect her ego and manipulate perceptions to her advantage.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement and subtle anxiety about the upcoming game and the prospect of manipulating her friends into going to her preferred pub.
          current daily occupation: likely a pub-goer who enjoys watching sports and socializing with friends, particularly at her preferred establishment, The White Hart.

          16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are enjoying coffee and pastries; they are planning to watch a soccer game later that night.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is at a market with friends, planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is at a market with friends, planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards a pub that suits her preferences, potentially The White Hart, while subtly manipulating the conversation to ensure her opinion is valued.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are enjoying coffee and pastries; they are planning to watch a soccer game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "Hmm, The Duke of York is alright, but haven't we been there the last couple of times? I was thinking maybe we could try somewhere different this time?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The White Hart.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a manipulative and self-centered individual who prioritizes her own desires above the needs and feelings of others. She is skilled at crafting narratives to protect her ego and manipulate perceptions to her advantage.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement and subtle anxiety about the upcoming game and the prospect of manipulating her friends into going to her preferred pub.
          current daily occupation: likely a pub-goer who enjoys watching sports and socializing with friends, particularly at her preferred establishment, The White Hart.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Casually steer the conversation towards pubs, subtly highlighting the merits of The White Hart, perhaps mentioning the skilled mixologists and passionate staff.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Suggest checking out The White Hart's menu online, subtly implying a preference for their offerings.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] If anyone else suggests a different pub, politely express interest but subtly highlight any potential downsides (e.g., "It's a bit crowded there on match nights, isn't it?").
          [14 May 2015 18:00] Arrive at The White Hart a bit early to secure a good table.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Settle in, order drinks, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere, making sure to engage in lively conversation with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 20:00] Cheer enthusiastically during the game, making sure to be seen enjoying herself.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hmm, The Duke of York is alright, but haven't we been there the last couple of times? I was thinking maybe we could try somewhere different this time?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest his favorite pub, The Duke of York, but would be open to trying a new place if his friends prefer.

        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hmm, The Duke of York is alright, but haven't we been there the last couple of times? I was thinking maybe we could try somewhere different this time?


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are discussing where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, watching football, and having a good time.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest his favorite pub, The Duke of York, but would be open to trying a new place if his friends prefer.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue relaxing with friends in Victoria Park, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Continue relaxing with friends in Victoria Park, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Begin making their way towards The Duke of York pub.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Arrive at The Duke of York, secure a good table with a view of the screen, and order drinks.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Catch up with friends, enjoy pre-game banter, and soak in the pub atmosphere.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game with friends, cheering and celebrating every goal.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub, perhaps discussing the game or making plans for future outings.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          Jack Taylor's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be excited to meet up with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere of the pub, and cheer on his team during the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, watching football, and having a good time.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a sociable and thrill-seeking individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football at his favorite pub.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely suggest his favorite pub, The Duke of York, but would be open to trying a new place if his friends prefer.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Duke of York to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight...
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York it is, then.
      Alexander White -- "That sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone up for a pint later? The Duke of York would be ideal.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Duke of York sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York is nice, but have you guys ever been to The White Hart? They make the best cocktails.
      Alexander White -- "The White Hart is a good shout, Alice. They do make a mean cocktail.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for the game, isn't it?
      Alice Lewis -- "Hmm, The Duke of York is alright, but haven't we been there the last couple of times? I was thinking maybe we could try somewhere different this time?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is a classic choice, can't go wrong with that.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social and intellectual person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games in pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a lively morning at a market with friends and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game. They are debating where to watch the game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market and planning to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to their favorite pub, The Duke of York, to watch the game with their friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York, obviously.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.

    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
